ygData.subject: Announcing Petalz: A New NEAT-based Facebook Game Now in Beta
ygData.msgSnippet: I m pleased to announce the open beta test of a new Facebook social game that originated here in our lab at UCF called Petalz.  You can play it here:

Subject: Announcing Petalz: A New NEAT-based Facebook Game Now in Beta
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=54567749; y=fS5TWc0hl_-lyDHr7xMbfzWe72qLjH3ZNoktNzyI9AlTnixZ-cA5
X-Yahoo-Profile: kenstanley01

I'm pleased to announce the open beta test of a new Facebook social game th=
at originated here in our lab at UCF called Petalz.  You can play it here:
=

http://apps.facebook.com/petalzgame/

Petalz builds on a custom version of=
 NEAT and a specialized CPPN-based flower encoding to allow players to bree=
d endless unique and beautiful flowers on their own balconies that friends =
can visit.  You can then sell your flowers to other players in a global mar=
ketplace (who can then breed them further) or even send them to other frien=
ds on Facebook.  Under the hood, CPPNs are powering Petalz to allow the flo=
wers to evolve.  (And of course they can actually increase in complexity ov=
er many generations too because of NEAT.)  Crossover is also a fun operator=
 here (called cross-pollination in the game), and often the children of two=
 parent flowers noticeably resemble both parents.

While I mentioned that P=
etalz originated in our EPlex lab here at UCF (in an effort led by Sebastia=
n Risi, who has now moved on to a postdoc at Cornell), we ultimately made t=
he decision to spin it out of the university into a company (called FinchBe=
ak) to make it possible for us to support a real social game based on NEAT.=
  The main partners behind the effort are Sebastian Risi (FinchBeak Preside=
nt), David D'Ambrosio, Joel Lehman, Ryan Hall, and myself.  Ashlee Hynes cr=
eated much of the art.  So indeed Petalz is now a commercial effort (based =
on free-to-play with optional microtransactions), but I think of course it'=
s relevant to NEAT Users hopefully as inspiration for the possibilities it =
suggests in making some real-world products with neuroevolution technology.=


At the moment the game is starting an open Beta, so we're not actively pr=
omoting it outside this group.  But we are very happy for this community to=
 have an early opportunity to try it out and we welcome your comments and s=
uggestions.

When you drop in, feel free to stop by my balcony, see my flow=
ers, and say hello!  (You can find my balcony through flowers of mine that =
are on the market.)

ken
